channel.title: SevenAtSevenSection1
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenSection1, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 'Death fold' proteins can make cells self-destruct. Scientists want to control them
item.description: Scientists are hoping to treat diseases including cancer and Alzheimer's by influencing how cells make life-or-death decisions.

item.title: India’s Kuku snags $85M as mobile content wars intensify
item.description: Kuku plans to expand beyond India with a U.S. launch slated for next year.

item.title: How tiny Mubadala-backed AAF is winning VC deals in some of the hottest startups
item.description: In less than a decade AAF has backed startups with exits totaling $2 billion, it says and is doing so through an unusual VC model.

item.title: Seoul weighs approval for Google, Apple high-resolution map requests
item.description: South Korea weighs granting Google and Apple access to high-resolution map data amid lingering security and regulatory concerns.

item.title: Co-founder of Indian social network Koo releases a new photo sharing app
item.description: PicSee is a new app that detects your friends' photos on device and allows you to send it to them.

item.title: Alaska airlifting hundreds from storm-devastated coastal villages
item.description: Officials say one of the “most significant” airlifts in Alaska history is underway to evacuate hundreds of people from storm-devastated coastal towns.
